lyrics.text:
Make me a captive, Lord, and then I shall be free. Force me to render up my sword, and I shall conqueror be.
I sink in life's alarms when by myself I stand; imprison me within thine arms, and strong shall be my hand.

My heart is weak and poor until it master find; it has no spring of action sure, it varies with the wind.
It cannot freely move till thou hast wrought its chain; enslave it with thy matchless love, and deathless it shall reign.

My power is faint and low till I have learned to serve; it lacks the needed fire to glow, it lacks the breeze to nerve.
It cannot drive the world until itself be driven; its flag can only be unfurled when thou shalt breathe from heaven.

My will is not my own till thou hast made it thine; if it would reach a monarch's throne, it must its crown resign.
It only stands unbent amid the clashing strife, when on thy bosom it has leant, and found in thee its life.
